texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: By setting a certain bash environment variable, you can limit which commands are kept in the .bash_history file. The following options can be passed to the HISTCONTROL environmental variable:
texts.text: By setting a certain bash environment variable, you can limit which commands are kept in the .bash_history file. The following options can be passed to the HISTCONTROL environmental variable:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: ignorespace  - omits commands beginning with a space
texts.text: ignorespace  - omits commands beginning with a space

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: ignoredups  - omits commands that match the previously run command
texts.text: ignoredups  - omits commands that match the previously run command

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: erasedups  - removes previous lines that match the line that was just run
texts.text: erasedups  - removes previous lines that match the line that was just run

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: To set it, simply run the following from the command line, or add it to the .bashrc or a single user's .bash_profile:
texts.text: To set it, simply run the following from the command line, or add it to the .bashrc or a single user's .bash_profile:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: If no value is set, then all commands will be saved regardless of their content.
texts.text: If no value is set, then all commands will be saved regardless of their content.
